node.name: tsi2
node.node: Being able to trust others and negotiate, cooperate, work as a team, give and take, see other people`s point of view, cope when things don`t go your way, have good self-control, make wise choices and decisions that are good for you and others. able to laugh at themselvesable to laugh at themselvesunable to laugh at themselvesnullwould say sorry publicly if they had done something wrongwould say sorry publicly if they had done something wrongwould not say sorry publicly if they had done something wrongnullcurious about whats on pupils' mindscurious about whats on pupils' mindsnot interested in whats on pupils' mindsnullreads pupils like a bookreads pupils like a bookdoesn't understand pupils that wellnulltells pupils a bit about their life outside schooltells pupils a bit about their life outside schoolnever talks about their life outside schoolnullquestions rather than criticises pupilsquestions rather thaa criticises pupilscriticises rather than questions pupilsnull

I want-it-now attitude, I think I can just do what I like, I think I am better than everyone else. makes hurtful and sarcastic commentsdoesn't make hurtful and sarcastic commentsmakes hurtful and sarcastic commentsnullis arrogant and thinks they are better than everyone elseis not arrogantis arrogant and thinks they are better than everyone elsenullputs pupils on the spot can embarrasses pupilsavoids putting pupils on the spotputs pupils on the spot and embarrasses pupilsnullis feared by pupilsis not feared by pupilsis feared by pupilsnullgets annoyed easily and takes it out on the classwouldn’t take it out on the class if they got annoyedgets annoyed easily and takes it out on the classnullexpects pupils to follow their directions no matter whatexpects pupils to make their own mind up sometimesexpects pupils to follow their directions no matter whatnull

Being kind and friendly and comfortable with others, aware of the impact of your behaviour on others, care for, help and protect others, play safely with others, take a stand against bullying, be willing to depend on others. trusts pupilstrusts pupilsdoes not trust pupilsnullinvolves pupils in class decisionsinvolves pupils in class decisionsdoes not involve pupils in class decisionsnullsets clear rules sets clear rules does not set clear rules nullallows pupils to suggest better ways to do thingsallows pupils to suggest better ways to do thingsdoesn't allow pupils to suggest better ways to do thingsnullencourages pupils to ask questions and say what they thinkencourages pupils to ask questions and say what they thinkdoesn't encourage pupils to ask questions and say what they thinknullencourages pupils to work without their helpencourages pupils to work without their helpdoesn't encourage pupils to work without their helpnull

Annoying, alienating and rubbishing your peers, or going it alone, having doubts about others, finding it hard to make relationships. tries to please pupils too muchisn't a pupil pleasertries to please pupils too muchnulleasy to ignoreimpossible to ignoreeasy to ignorenullnags and moans at pupilsdoes not nag or moan at pupilsnags and moans at pupilsnullgives too many choicesdoesn't give too many choicesgives too many choicesnullcan be moodyis never moodycan be moodynulltoo soft with pupilsstrict with pupilstoo soft with pupilsnull

Try your best, stretch yourself, be conscientious, enjoy and be open to learning, be inquiring and creative, take criticism well, focus and shift attention and persist on tasks, and learn from mistakes. likes pupilslikes pupilsdislikes pupilsnullpupils enjoy telling them thingspupils enjoy telling them thingsis hard to talk tonullrespects pupils' point of viewrespects pupils' point of viewdoesn't see things from the pupil's point of viewnullis liked and respected by pupilsis liked and respected by pupilsis not liked or respected by pupilsnullshows interest in pupils' lives outside of schoolshows interest in pupils' lives outside of schoolnot interested in pupils' lives outside of schoolnullis patient is patient is impatientnull

Being lazy, do as little work as you can get away with, easily distracted and put off your work, don`t care about your work, feel you are good at nothing. has favourites doesn't have favourites has favourites nullis unfriendlyis friendlyis unfriendlynulltells some pupils they are better than others in front of classdoes not to compare pupils in front of the classtells some pupils they are better than others in front of classnullpicks on some pupils doesn't pick on some pupils picks on some pupils nulltalks down to pupilstalks pupils' languagetalks down to pupilsnullshouts at pupilsalways speaks qietly to pupilsshouts at pupilsnull

Express self and voice opinions, stand up for self, show your talents, resist peer pressure, push self, be competitive, be sure about self and what you want to do, show initiative, be decisive, direct and bold, make things happen, get things done. makes pupils feel proudmakes pupils feel proudmake pupils feel bad about themselvesnullfosters real interest in learningfosters real interest in learningdoesn't foster real interest in learningnullstretches pupils so they know how well they can dostretches pupils so they know how well they can dodoesn't stretch pupils gets excited and enthusiastic about thingsgets excited and enthusiastic about thingslacks enthusiasmnullencourages pupils to develop their interestsencourages pupils to develop their interestsdoesn't encourage pupils to develop their interestsnullsets goals that are hard but possiblesets goals that are hard but possiblesets goals that are too difficultnull

Being apprehensive, a bit of a pushover, avoiding being picked or taking on responsibilities; would like to get close to others but are apprehensive about being rejected, would like to get involved but worried about getting things wrong impossible to please is not impossible to please impossible to please nulltalks about pupils' bad points in front of the classdoesn't criticise pupils in front of the classtalks about pupils' bad points in front of the classnullcan be boringis rarely boringcan be boringnulldoes all the talkinglets pupils do some of the talkingdoes all the talkingnullis easily distracted and goes off the topicis focused and keeps on the topicis easily distracted and goes off the topicnullgives praise when pupils don't really deserve itgives praise only when pupils deserve itgives praise when pupils don't really deserve itnull

questions.question: How would your describe your teaching style?
What makes teaching worthwhile?
How much of your ability are you using in your school work? 0 - 100%
What is stopping you using all of your ability?
In teaching, how much of the time can you be your real self - 0 to 100%
What is blocking you being your real self?
Would you like to improve anything about your teaching style? If so , what?
Doing this questionnaire - Is there anything you have learned about your teaching style?
